IMO, It'd be better to use a ratcheting PVC cutter rather than a hacksaw. You can have it go straight through, but that doesn't always give a straight/even cut. You can wrap a strip of paper with a straight edge around it, then draw a line around the pipe in pencil, place it in the cutter, tighten the cutter, then twist the pipe along the line. Ratchet it gradually and keep twisting it.

This is merely for the purposes of having less PVC dust from cutting with the saw. You do however get a slight ridge... which may have to be filed off if you want it to fit into any connectors. :-P
